author: .vbuterin
content: there's no such thing as a compressed signature

author: .vbuterin
content: (at least, compressed to any significant extent)

author: .vbuterin
content: if you want signatures smaller than two field elements (~64 bytes), you need to go to BLS

author: .vbuterin
content: which incidentally lets you do really awesome things like https://ethresear.ch/t/adding-cross-transaction-bls-signature-aggregation-to-ethereum/7844

author: .vbuterin
content: The price is one pairing verification per transaction, which is much more expensive than an EC sig
